messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: Investigator Lewis, assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, moved the decedent and noted a spent casing. Technician Muhammad collected evidence. Sergeant McMullen briefed Detective Morton on a blood trail. Detective Aucoin secured the crime scene. At the Homicide Office, Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers tested eyewitnesses. The Coroner's Office classified the deaths as homicides per Detective David Trehan. Other officers involved included Detective Sergeant Chris Robert, Officer Juan Lopez, Officers Phil Burras & Quincy Broaden, Officers Nate Addison & Glen Hewitt, Detective Gregory Johnson, Detective Jason McGee, Detective Ananie Mitchell, Detective Melvin McCullum, Detective Pratt, and Scientific Criminal Investigations Division Officer Gary Sallienger.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, moved the decedent and noted a spent casing at the crime scene.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Collected evidence at the crime scene including a spent casing.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Briefed Detective Morton on a blood trail at the crime scene.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective AucoinOfficer Context: Secured the crime scene and ensured it was locked and sealed.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on eyewitnesses at the Homicide Office.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: Work at the Coroner's Office led to the classification of deaths as homicides.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Sergeant Chris RobertOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: Detective SergeantOfficer Name: Officer Juan LopezOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Officers Phil Burras & Quincy BroadenOfficer Context: Mentioned as a team in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Officers Nate Addison & Glen HewittOfficer Context: Mentioned as a team in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Detective Gregory JohnsonOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Jason McGeeOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Ananie MitchellOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Melvin McCullumOfficer Context: Mentioned in the narrative with no specific context provided.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective PrattOfficer Context: Handled a crime scene on Mazant Street as part of the Homicide Section.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Officer Gary SalliengerOfficer Context: Worked on sketching a broken piece of doorjamb as part of the crime scene sketch.Officer Role: Scientific Criminal Investigations Division Officer
